page.title: 18VISITS: FARLEIGH HUNGERFORD
page.content: AT THE T-JUNCTION (G.R.800 575) NEAR THE CASTLE, THERE IS AN OLD-FASHIONED RED TELEPHONE BOX. IT IS SITUATED OPPOSITE THE{HUNGERFORD ARMS,}A PUBLIC HOUSE COMMANDING A MARVELLOUS VIEW OF THE LIMPLEY STOKE VALLEY AND THE CASTLE RUINS. THE CASTLE WAS BUILT ON A NATURAL ESCARPMENT, AND SO WAS EASILY DEFENDED. OTHER PLACES OF INTEREST IN THE AREA TO THE WEST OF FARLEIGH HUNGERFORD, INCLUDE A{FALCONRY}(795 579), A LARGE MIXED WOOD (79 56) AND THE SITE OF A {ROMAN VILLA}(79 58). ACCESS TO THESE SITES IS RESTRICTED, DUE TO THE NARROWNESS OF MANY OF THE SURROUNDING LANES. FARLEIGH HUNGERFORD IS ALSO WITHIN EASY REACH OF MANY OTHER PLACES OF INTEREST, SUCH AS{NORTON ST. PHILIP, {LIMPLEY STOKE}AND{BATH.}
